means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 加洛普绰号，鲁莽人，来源于现代英语，含义是“跑”(run)

word_mean: 奔马律：心脏的一种病态节律。见rhythm项下

sentence.Network_en: I read the book at a gallop.
sentence.Network_cn: 我飞快地读完了这本书。

sentence.Network_en: I was forced to attempt a gallop.
He saddled his horse, mounted, and rode away at a gallop.
sentence.Network_cn: 他给马套上鞍子, 跨上马背疾驰而去.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 奔字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 奔泻〖 (oftorrents)rush(pour)down〗 奔驰〖 gallop;runquickly;speed〗 奔窜〖 fleeabout〗.
普通英汉小词典_翻译家(Fanyijia.com) ... gallon 加□ gallop 疾驰 gamble 赌博.
NK-words2 - 博客的日志 - 网易博客 ... gallon 加仑 gallop 奔驰，飞奔 gamble 投机，冒险；赌博.
字典中逸字的解释 ... (2) 同本义[ escape] (4) 奔跑[ gallop] (6) 超越[ excel].

list.abs: ...p）。其产生机制是舒张末期左心室压力增高和顺应性降低，左心房为克服增大的心室充盈阻力而加强收缩所致，因而也称为房性奔马律（atrial gallop）。来自右心房的舒张晚期奔马律极少见。
gallop rhythm 奔马律gallop sound 奔马律音gallstone 胆石
实用英语：常用英汉财经词汇(g)galloping inflation 恶性通货膨胀GATT 关税与贸易总协定(简称关贸总协定).
进出口行业词汇英语翻译(G) ... galloon ribbon 横棱纹缎带 galloping horse 跃马 Gallotox 赛力散.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: from Old French galop (noun), galoper, variants of Old Northern French walop, waloper (see wallop)

entry.def: When a horse gallops, it runs very fast so that all four legs are off the ground at the same time. If you gallop a horse, you make it gallop.

example.ex: Staff officers galloped fine horses down the road.
example.tran: 参谋官们骑着骏马一路疾驰而去。

entry.def: If you gallop, you ride a horse that is galloping.

example.ex: Major Winston galloped into the distance.
example.tran: 温斯顿少校策马疾驰而去。

entry.def: A gallop is a ride on a horse that is galloping.

example.ex: I was forced to attempt a gallop.

entry.def: If something such as a process gallops, it develops very quickly and is often difficult to control.

example.ex: In spite of the recession, profits have galloped ahead.
example.tran: 尽管还处于萧条期，利润却迅猛增长。

entry.def: If you gallop, you run somewhere very quickly.

example.ex: They are galloping around the garden playing football.
example.tran: 他们在园子里飞跑着踢足球。

entry.def: If you do something at a gallop, you do it very quickly.

example.ex: I read the book at a gallop.
example.tran: 我飞快地读完了这本书。

means.word_mean: 1. a fast gait of a horse; a two-beat stride during which all four legs are off the ground simultaneously
3. cause to move at full gallop;

sentences.sentence: "Did you gallop the horse just now?"

auth_sentence.content: They went a good old gallop and he proved he stays.
auth_sentence.res_content: They went a good old gallop and he proved he stays.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They went a good old gallop and he proved he stays.

auth_sentence.content: This is the "most wired generation" ever, says Gallop.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is the "most wired generation" ever, says Gallop.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is the "most wired generation" ever, says Gallop.

auth_sentence.content: Do not gallop through my letter...but read it over and over again.
auth_sentence.res_content: Do not gallop through my letter...but read it over and over again.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Do not gallop through my letter...but read it over and over again.

sentences.en: He saddled his horse, mounted, and rode away at a gallop.
sentences.cn: 他给马套上鞍子, 跨上马背疾驰而去。

sentences.en: The children galloped home as soon as the class was over.
sentences.cn: 孩子们一下课便飞奔回家了。

sentences.en: Japan is gallop-ing ahead in the race to develop new technology.
sentences.cn: 日本在发展新技术的竞争中进展迅速, 日新月异。

sentences.en: He galloped the horse along the track.
He galloped through his work so that he could leave the office early.
sentences.cn: 他快速干完他的工作, 以便能早点离开办公室。

jushi.english: The children galloped home as soon as the class was over.
jushi.chinese: 孩子们一下课便飞奔回家了。

jushi.english: Japan is galloping ahead in the race to develop new technology.
jushi.chinese: 日本在发展新技术的竞争中进展迅速,日新月异。
